<desc><s>It's a photograph from a Polaroid camera.</s> <s>It shows Faust standing in the kitchen, holding an entire container of chocolate chip ice cream and a bottle of chardonnay.</s> <s>He's staring at the blender, looking confused.</s></desc>

<desc><s>It's a photo from a polaroid camera!</s> <s>It shows Anzu, Cara, Faust, Ikeda, Oshiro, Pearl, Yuu, and Zoran posing for the camera in the dining hall.</s> <s>Ikeda stands on the left side, arms crossed as she looks at the camera with a nervous smile. Beside her, Oshiro, who is wearing a full set of armor minus the helmet, has an arm wrapped around Cara's shoulder and gives the camera a thumbs up while Cara beams, her hand on top of Zoran's head. Zoran's smile is slightly awkward, his shoulders tense, and Anzu stands beside him, wearing a half-assed smile. Beside Cara, Faust grins with his usual dorky smile, and to his left stands Pearl, also smiling. Yuu stands behind Faust and Pearl, an arm around each of their shoulders.</s></desc>

<desc><s>It's a photo from a polaroid camera!</s> <s>It shows Anzu, Cara, Faust, Ikeda, Oshiro, Pearl, Yuu, and Monomi posing for the camera in the dining hall.</s> <s>Ikeda stands on the left side, arms crossed as she looks at the camera with a slight scowl. Beside her, Oshiro, who is wearing a full set of armor minus the helmet, grins at the camera while flexing her biceps. Cara stands beside her, smiling with her eyes closed and pointing to the ceiling with one hand, the other hand resting on Monomi's head. Monomi stands proudly at the front of the group beside Anzu, who stands with her hands folded together in front of her, her posture relaxed, almost cocky. Faust stands next to Cara, doing bunny ears behind her head while Jojo posing. Yuu is watching Anzu with a slightly nervous expression, and to his left stands Pearl, who looks over at the others. He looks like he was laughing as the photo was taken.</s></desc>

<desc><s>It's one of those guitar accessories for a guitar-based video game.</s> <s>The body is red and shaped like Monokuma's eye, making it kind of uncomfortable to hold.</s> <s>Thankfully it comes with a strap so you don't have to just carry it around in your hands.</s> <s>You're pretty sure there are no games around that support this thing, but maybe you could use it as a weapon.</s></desc>

<desc><s>It's a copy of Monokuma Party 5 for the Gamecube.</s> <s>In this game, four players go around a board collecting Hope Fragments and Monocoins, with a mini-game between each turn, and whoever has the most Hope Fragments at the end destroys them and wins.</s> <s>The back of the box says "It's an all-out bash!" and advertises that it has "more than 70 all-new mini-games!</s> <s>Looks like the playable roster includes Monokuma, Monotaro, Monosuke, Monodam, Monophanie, Monokid, Monoman, Monocrow, Monosnek, and Zero III.</s> <s>Who are all these characters?</s> <s>There's no way this is real, right?</s> <s>This has to be a bad mod of [REMOVED TO CONFORM WITH LOCAL AND INTERNATIONAL COPYRIGHT LAWS].</s></desc>

<desc><s>It's a copy of Monomi's Mansion for the Gamecube.</s> <s>In this game, you control Monomi, who wields a vacuum cleaner which she uses to suck up Monokuma ghosts while she looks for her sister in a haunted mansion.</s></desc>
a copy of SUPER SMASH BEARS MELEE

<desc><s>It's a copy of Super Smash Bears: Melee for the Gamecube.</s> <s>It's a fighting game where the entire roster is comprised of famous fictional bears, including: Monokuma, Freddy Fazbear, Po, Banjo, Rilakkuma, Teddie from Persona 4, Winnie the Pooh, Yogi Bear, Fozzie Bear, the Berenstain Bears, the Coca-Cola polar bear, several Care Bears, and the list goes on.</s> <s>Well... Monokuma's in it, so you guess they aren't *all* fictional, but you're pretty sure none of the others really exist.</s> <s>At least... you hope not.</s></desc>
a copy of BENDY PATH OF INK

<desc><s>It's a copy of Bendy: Path of Ink for the Gamecube.</s> <s>It's a tactical role-playing game where you play as Bendy, who fights in a band of mercenaries to drive the forces of a certain corporation with a mouse mascot out of the Joey Drew Studios executive office.</s> <s>This sounds like the worst game you've ever heard of.</s></desc>

<desc><s>It's a copy of Resident Despair 4 for the Gamecube.</s> <s>It's a survival horror, third-person shooter where you take control of a high school girl with a megaphone that she uses to shoot Monokumas.</s> <s>For some reason this sounds very familiar...</s></desc>

<desc><s>It's a copy of The Urbz: Sims in the City for the Gamecube.</s> <s>In this game, you play as a customizable character living their new life in the city, with the goal of boosting their reputation in all nine of the city's districts.</s> <s>Along ther way, they'll be helped by will.i.am from the Black Eyed Peas and his friend Darius.</s> <s>Judging from the characters on the cover art, this is DEFINITELY a game from the early 2000s...</s></desc>
inflict player walkie talkie / cure player walkie talkie

<desc><s>It's a high-powered walkie talkie used to communicate from a distance.</s> <s>Look like you can switch it on and off pretty easily, though if you turn it off you'll have no idea if someone on the other line is trying to reach you.</s> <s>(Note: In order to turn it on, use the .equip command. While powered on, the person on the other line, and anyone in the room with them, will hear everything you say. To turn it off, use the .unequip command.)</s></desc>

It's a letter in a torn envelope. The sender is someone named Anthony White, and it appears to be addressed to Makoto Tamochi. You pull out the letter and read it:
"Dear Makoto,

I got your email, but before I could respond, the Internet here got cut out. I hope this letter makes it to you safely. Kumar is the only other member of the scouting committee who I've found alive. I don't know about all the others, least of all Friedrich.

Things are getting worse and worse out here every day. I thought I was lucky being far away from the school when the bomb dropped, but I'm starting to wish I had been on campus. Nowhere is safe anymore. There were a lot of refugees when this all started, but more and more people keep turning on us.

Still, I stood by your decision when you founded this school, and I still stand by you. If you think relocating the students is a good idea, I'll support your decision. I sent Kumar your way with supplies and this letter. Well, I guess if you're reading this, you know that already.

Good luck out there. I'll keep doing my part.

Your friend,
Anthony White

P.S.: I've been looking for your wife. I wanted to tell her that you're okay, and hopefully get her out there with you. No luck so far, but if I find her, you'll know."

It's a piece of white paper with a message written on it in red ink: "Meet me in the break room at 5 PM.
-Kyra"

It's a short news clipping.
```May 11th, 2021

The former Ultimate Biologist of Hope’s Peak’s Class 1, Victoria Takayoshi, made a startling announcement at the International Conference for Robotics earlier today. She has revealed the creation of a fully-functioning android with an AI that is so lifelike it is able to blend in perfectly with society. You may wonder, how does she know it’s flawless?

As it turns out, her own daughter, Natalie Spark, originally known as the Ultimate DJ, is that exact android. She’s been living under our noses for years now, along with her family, who have known all along.

Her other “parent”, Ashley Spark, is a renowned programmer who created her own programming language, which Takayoshi claims was used to create this Ultimate Android. That, along with Takayoshi’s invention of a biomass reactor that converts organic waste into energy, is what allowed this artificial intelligence to perform in this manner.

Multiple reporters have asked Takayoshi what else she has been hiding from the world, but she has declined to comment.```
